title: Source: Commanders RB Ekeler has torn Achilles
content: Commanders running back Austin Ekeler has suffered a torn right Achilles that will keep him out for the rest of the season, a source told ESPN.

title: Dolphins not planning to trade Hill, sources say
content: The Dolphins have no plans to trade Tyreek Hill and haven't received any calls from teams interested in the star wide receiver, sources told ESPN.

title: Ex-Aspiration CEO denies Kawhi had no-show deal
content: The former CEO of Aspiration, the company that Clippers owner Steve Ballmer is accused of using to circumvent the salary cap, says claims that Kawhi Leonard signed a no-show contract with his former company are false.

title: Browns activate RB Judkins prior to Ravens game
content: The Browns have activated rookie running back Quinshon Judkins prior to Sunday's Week 2 road game against the Baltimore Ravens.

title: Vols land 6-foot-3 Edwards, No. 2 recruit in '26
content: Oliviyah Edwards, the No. 2 player in the 2026 SportsCenter NEXT 100 class, has committed to Tennessee. The 6-foot-3 forward is the highest-rated recruit for the Lady Volunteers since 2019 and the first top-five recruit for coach Kim Caldwell.

title: Bar√ßa boss Flick slams Spain over Yamal injury
content: Barcelona boss Hansi Flick accused Spain of "not taking care" of Lamine Yamal during the international break after he was ruled out of Sunday's match.

title: USA's Crouser, mixed relay open worlds with golds
content: U.S. shot put thrower Ryan Crouser made it three world championships in a row to go with his three straight Olympic golds, while the American 4x400 mixed relay team built a lead that not even comeback artist Femke Bol of the Netherlands could overcome.

content: A Clippers limited partner invested $1.99 million in Aspiration nine days before the company made an overdue $1.75 million payment to Kawhi Leonard, according to a report.

title: ‚ÜîÔ∏è Jags trade RB Bigsby to Eagles for draft picks
content: The Jaguars have traded running back Tank Bigsby to the Eagles for 2026 fifth- and sixth-round picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Serie A clubs queue up for Zirkzee
content: Juventus are leading the Serie A clubs vying to bring in Joshua Zirkzee from Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: With nine months until the World Cup begins, which U.S. players are best positioned to make the squad after a turbulent September window?

content: Volunteers quarterback Josh Dobbs found wide receiver Jauan Jennings for a miraculous Hail Mary -- in 2016.

content: Andre Snellings lays out what it takes to put yourself in the best position to win your fantasy basketball league.

title: Adani Power to invest $3 billion to set up 2400 MW power project in Bihar
content: The Adani group company, in a statement, said that it has signed a 25-year Power Supply Agreement (PSA) with Bihar State Power Generation Company Ltd. (BSPGCL) to supply power from the project that will come up at Pirpainti in Bhagalpur district of the state

title: PM Modi congratulates Sushila Karki, Nepal‚Äôs first woman PM
content: Addressing a gathering in Manipur, Mr. Modi expresses confidence that Ms. Karki will pave the way for peace and stability in the neighbouring country

content: The order would act as a precedent against the government interfering in or caveating private wills without first proving intestacy, and a complete absence of heirs

title: Let Revanth Reddy make 10 defected MLAs quit and re-contest, if he has faith in his work: KTR
content: BRS working president flays Gadwal MLA Krishna Mohan Reddy for his ‚Äúneither here nor there condition‚Äù

title: One more Maoist killed by security forces in Bijapur operation
content: After two Maoists had been killed on Friday, another body was recovered today under the same operation, Bijapur SP Jitendra Kumar Yadav said

title: BJP seeks Governor‚Äôs intervention in Malayalam university ‚Äòland fraud‚Äô
content: Party says the land was bought at cheap rates from ‚Çπ4,000 to ‚Çπ7,000 a cent and sold to the government for ‚Çπ1.7 lakh a cent. Sports Minister V. Abdurahiman, former Higher Education Minister K.T. Jaleel had role in scam, it alleges

title: Bhupen Hazarika taught us humanity: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister released a ‚Çπ100 centenary commemorative coin, and a biography on the legendary singer-composer

content: Venue of the two-day conclave gets a facelift and full-fledged security fortification in view of the arrival of political leaders from across the nation; 220 vehicles arranged for the transportation of VVIPs

title: Constitution empowers India to overcome challenges, says Ravi Shankar Prasad
content: Mr. Prasad was speaking at the inaugural Bhuvneshwari Dayal Memorial Lecture on the theme ‚ÄúIndia‚Äôs Constitutional Journey over the Past 75 Years‚Äù organised by B. D. College

title: Revanth asserts Telangana‚Äôs claim over 904 TMC ft Krishna waters
content: For decades, Telangana suffered injustice in Krishna allocations. This is our opportunity to rectify the wrongs and secure every drop due to us, the Chief Minister told officials

title: Kerala Cabinet nod for draft Bill seeking to give permission to resume ‚ÄòKaalapoottu‚Äô
content: Agriculture-related cattle race events known as ‚ÄòMaramadi,‚Äô ‚ÄòKaalapoottu,‚Äô ‚ÄòKannupoottu‚Äô and ‚ÄòPothottam‚Äô  had been banned under the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, 1960

content: Event in New Delhi on September 16 to release NCB‚Äôs Annual Report and launch online Drug Disposal Campaign

content: Prof. Jagdeep S. Chhokar‚Äôs journey may have ended, but his contributions have become part of the law of the land, ensuring that his work and vision will live on forever

title: Singareni to deploy women operators in opencast mines soon¬†
content: Those who are working as general assistants, badli workers to get the opportunity as SCCL plans to utilise in-house human resources first

title: KFRI to host global workshop on forest landscape restoration from September 14¬†
content: International experts and local scientists to converge to turn cutting-edge research into actionable strategies for restoring forest ecosystems

title: Jagan misleading public on Pulivendula Medical College works, alleges MLC Ramagopal Reddy
content: Most of the civil work remains incomplete, and buildings meant for students‚Äô hostels and staff quarters are nowhere in sight, he asserts

title: Gujarat government‚Äôs nutrition scheme provides meals to 40 lakh students
content: The programme provides primary school students snacks everyday that contain approximately 200 kilocalories and 6 grams of protein per serving

title: As long as I‚Äôm with people, my age and gender hardly matter, says Colombo Mayor
content: Colombo‚Äôs youngest and only second woman mayor says old political hierarchies are being toppled and emphasizes working closely with citizens to understand their needs

content: APCC vice-president says assurance should come from Jagan, seeks apology for ‚Äòthree-capitals blunder‚Äô

title: Congress leader N.M. Vijayan‚Äôs daughter-in-law attempts suicide
content: Padmaja alleges that Congress cheated her family by not clearing the debt of ‚Çπ2.5 crore her father-in-law had incurred allegedly at the behest of the party

title: Plastic mementos draw flak at urban conclave
content: Even as the conclave commits to framing a policy on climate-resilient urbanisation, The use of plastic gifts raises questions about its commitment to a sustainability ethos, says lead member of the Kerala Urban Policy Commission

title: YSRCP trying to regain lost ground by making positive comments on Amaravati: TDP MLA
content: Jagan Mohan Reddy should make an open statement if he wants people to believe that YSRCP is in favour of Amaravati as the sole capital of A.P., says Tenali Shravan Kumar

content: The Union Minister claims INDIA bloc¬†leaders are only hungry for power and that is their vision and mission; he also claimed that they are concerned about their own self-interest, and have no concern for the people of Bihar or India

title: CPA meet adopts four-point resolution to increase people‚Äôs trust in institutions
content: The 11th¬†Commonwealth Parliamentary Association, India region conference, which concluded here on Saturday, adopted a four-point resolution in order to increase people‚Äôs trust in democratic institutions

title: Kerala Health department ‚Äúrevises‚Äù figures on amoebic meningoencephalitis
content: The latest data released by the department did not mention any suspected cases or deaths. As per the data on September 12, there were a total of 66 confirmed cases and 17 deaths this year

title: I wanted to burn down social media at that point: Tollywood actor Sai Durga Tej on YouTuber child abuse case
content: Abhayam, a summit on child safety, was organised by the Confederation of Indian Industry in Hyderabad on Saturday; actor stresses on digital detox at the summit

title: TTD EO stresses use of technology to better serve Tirumala pilgrims
content: Singhal reviews facilities ahead of Brahmotsavams, pushes for facial recognition, faster tracing of missing persons, and improved Sevak training

title: Watch: Falling fertility rate, antibiotic resistance and a rare brain infection in Kerala
content: We unpack India‚Äôs falling fertility rate and its far-reaching social and economic consequences, examine the growing threat of antibiotic resistance, and assess the impact of recent GST reforms on healthcare. Our Kerala correspondent reports on the challenges of covering cases of amoebic meningoencephalitis, and psychiatrist Dr. Lakshmi Vijayakumar highlights the urgent need for open conversations on youth and mental health.

title: Chargesheets being readied in CSR scam cases
content: Police plan is to file chargesheets in cases registered over individual complaints first. They may invoke Banning of Unregulated Deposit Schemes Act, 2019 in the cases registered over the scam

title: Bhogapuram airport construction progressing as scheduled, says Union Minister K. Rammohan Naidu
content: The Minister has been apprised that additional manpower has been deployed to complete works in time and begin operations by June, 2026

title: Supreme Court to pronounce verdict on stay of Waqf (Amendment) Act 2025 on September 15
content: The Union Government had defended the constitutionality of the waqf amendments, noting that practice of charity through creation of waqfs was not an essential part of Islam

title: Forum welcomes APIC‚Äôs live streaming of RTI hearings, but flags certain gaps
content: Selective disclosure of orders and non-release of Annual Report raise questions on the Commission‚Äôs overall commitment to transparency, says United Forum for RTI Campaign

title: A. Siri assumes charge as Kurnool Collector
content: My focus will be to resolve the drinking water problem in the district and increase the ground water levels,‚Äù says new Collector

title: Politics heats up over India-Pak match: Oppn corners govt, BJP cites 'compulsion'
content: The upcoming India-Pakistan Asia Cup clash ignites political controversy. Shiv Sena (UBT) and Congress leaders criticize the match as immoral and profit-driven, citing past grievances and questioning the government's stance. BJP leaders, however, rally behind the Indian team, framing it as a matter of national pride. Maharashtra leaders exchange barbs, highlighting the deep divisions surrounding the event.

title: Davis Cup: Epic! India defeat Switzerland for a rare milestone since 1993
content: India have made it to the Davis Cup Qualifiers. Sumit Nagal's win over Henry Bernet sealed the victory against Switzerland. This is India's first away win against a European team since 1993. Nagal's return to the Davis Cup proved crucial. Earlier, N Sriram Balaji and Rithvik Bollipalli lost the doubles match. The Davis Cup Qualifiers are scheduled for January 2026.

title: 'Violation of women's dignity': FIR against Cong leaders over AI clip of PM's mother
content: An FIR has been filed in Delhi against Congress leaders following the circulation of an AI-generated video featuring Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his late mother. The video, shared by the Bihar Congress, has been described as defamatory and insulting. BJP leaders have strongly condemned the video, while Congress defends it as not disrespectful, sparking a political controversy.

title: Nano Banana trend: Turn photos into 3D figurines with Google AI Studio; 15 easy prompts
content: Google's new AI image editor, "Nano Banana," integrated into the Gemini app, allows users to effortlessly transform photos into 3D models. This tool, officially known as Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, has seen widespread adoption, with over 200 million images created or modified. Users can easily generate 3D figurines, designer pet toys, and fantasy avatars using simple text prompts.

title: SC dismisses NUJS's sexual harassment complaint; orders VC to mention judgment in resume
content: The Supreme Court dismissed a sexual harassment complaint against the NUJS Vice-Chancellor, citing a delay in filing beyond the POSH Act's limitation period. While the court acknowledged the delayed complaint, it directed that the judgment be included in the Vice-Chancellor's resume. This unusual directive serves as a permanent record of the allegations, despite their dismissal on procedural grounds.

title: ‚ÄòWe can do better‚Äô: Nadella admits empathy gap; warns of tough road ahead
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella acknowledged the need to rebuild employee trust following layoffs and a return-to-office mandate. He addressed concerns about a perceived lack of empathy and committed to improvement.

title: Asia Cup: Big blow to India ahead of Pakistan game! Star batter hit on the hands
content: India faced a scare ahead of their crucial Asia Cup match against Pakistan as Shubman Gill was struck on the hand during practice, causing visible discomfort. The team physio attended to him, and his condition is being closely monitored. This setback occurs just before the highly anticipated clash, adding pressure to India's preparations.

title: ‚Äò50‚Äì100% tariff‚Äô: Trump threatens China; presses Nato to unite on Russia sanctions
content: Donald Trump has proposed significant tariffs on Chinese goods and urged NATO allies to cease oil purchases from Russia to swiftly end the war in Ukraine. He criticized NATO's commitment and blamed Biden and Zelenskyy for prolonging the conflict.

title: Are you experiencing 'tall poppy syndrome'? Subtle workplace signs to notice
content: Tall Poppy Syndrome, prevalent globally but originating in Australia and New Zealand, describes the phenomenon of high achievers being subtly undermined in workplaces. A study reveals this affects women disproportionately, impacting confidence and mental health. This manifests as exclusion, downplaying ambition, and reluctance to showcase creative work, hindering both individual growth and organizational innovation.

title: 'Left no choice': Amazon suspends engineer; sent 'threatening' letter to CEO
content: Amazon has suspended a Palestinian software engineer for criticizing its business ties with Israel, specifically the Project Nimbus cloud computing contract. Ahmed Shahrour's internal communications expressing opposition led to his suspension and an ongoing investigation. He alleges the company suppresses pro-Palestinian voices, a claim Amazon denies, while similar protests have resulted in terminations at Microsoft and Google.

title: China gold licences: Yellow metal‚Äôs largest buyer to ease rules; diversify from dollar
content: China is easing gold import/export licensing, aiming to diversify reserves from the US dollar. The People's Bank of China (PBOC) plans to broaden the use of faster ‚Äúmulti-use permits‚Äù by increasing authorized ports and extending permit validity. This builds on a 2016 initiative to streamline gold trade.

title: Fact check: Does putting a claw clip on the eyebrow really help with migraines?
content: A viral social media trend suggests using claw clips on eyebrows to alleviate migraines, garnering millions of views. While some users report relief, Dr. Suzanne Wylie expresses skepticism, citing a lack of scientific evidence. Neurologist Soniya Tambe Jinde explains the potential benefit through the Gate Control Theory of Pain, where pressure may reduce pain signals reaching the brain. Read below!

title: Asia Cup: India coach reacts to Pakistan match boycott talks - 'Players are aware'
content: Amidst strong calls for boycott following the Pahalgam terror attack, India's cricket team support staff has addressed the sensitive issue before the Asia Cup clash against Pakistan. While acknowledging public sentiment, the team management, led by Gautam Gambhir's message to focus on cricket, emphasized adherence to BCCI and government directives, prioritizing the game while respecting the authorities' decisions.

title: 'Who cares?': Channing Frye targets Pablo Torre ‚Äî Clippers report heat
content: The NBA is investigating the Los Angeles Clippers for alleged salary cap circumvention related to Kawhi Leonard's compensation. Investigative journalist Pablo Torre reported the allegations, sparking reactions from figures like Channing Frye, who initially criticized Torre before walking back his comments. Torre has since responded to Frye's remarks, as the league's investigation continues, with more details expected to emerge.

title: 'Connected by shared history': PM Modi's message to Nepal; lauds Sushila Karki
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during his visit to Manipur, extended congratulations to Sushila Karki on becoming Nepal's first woman Prime Minister, reaffirming India's strong ties with Nepal. He lauded Nepal's democratic values and the resilience of its people. Modi also addressed the Manipur crisis, assuring support and urging peace for progress in the region.

title: Waqf Amendment Act: SC to deliver interim order Monday; ‚Äòwaqf by user‚Äô in focus
content: The Supreme Court is set to deliver its interim order on Monday regarding petitions challenging the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025's constitutional validity. These petitions, including one from Asaduddin Owaisi, question the inclusion of non-Muslims in Waqf boards and the recognition of "waqf by user" properties.

title: Asia Cup: IND vs PAK to be boycotted? Widow after Pahalgam attack blasts BCCI
content: Aishanya Dwivedi, widow of a victim in the Pahalgam terror attack, has passionately appealed for a boycott of the upcoming India-Pakistan Asia Cup match, criticising the BCCI's decision and the silence of Indian cricketers. She questions the sponsors and broadcasters, urging fans to abstain from watching the game, fearing revenue will fund terrorism.

title: 'Everything gets harder': Arshdeep after benched vs UAE; post goes viral
content: Ahead of the crucial Asia Cup clash against Pakistan, Arshdeep Singh's cryptic Instagram post sparked speculation about his mindset after being benched. Batting coach Sitanshu Kotak defended the team selection, emphasizing that decisions are based on conditions and team balance. As India prepares to face Pakistan, the possibility of including a second pacer looms, leaving Arshdeep's potential inclusion uncertain.

title: ‚ÄòDemanded job again‚Äô: Fired worker kills Hyderabad bizman in full public view; manhunt on
content: In Hyderabad, real estate businessman Srikanth Reddy was fatally stabbed in Moulali's HB Colony on Friday. The primary suspect, Dhanraj, a former employee fired for intoxication, repeatedly sought re-employment. After receiving money for liquor, Dhanraj, along with an accomplice Daniel, returned and attacked Srikanth when his job request was denied.

title: Saquon Barkley vs Chiefs: Bold warning to defense ‚Äî Super Bowl rematch set
content: Saquon Barkley fired back at the Kansas City Chiefs ahead of the Philadelphia Eagles‚Äô Super Bowl LIX rematch. After being shut down in February, the star running back warned Kansas City‚Äôs defense that if they fail to stack the box, he will punish them. Barkley looks to bounce back as Philadelphia visits Arrowhead Stadium on Sept. 14.

title: 'Just say when': Donald Trump pleads Nato nations to sanction Russia
content: Donald Trump stated his willingness to impose significant sanctions on Russia, contingent on all NATO nations ceasing Russian oil imports and implementing similar measures. He criticized some NATO members for continuing energy purchases from Russia, deeming it detrimental to the alliance's negotiating strength. Trump also suggested imposing substantial tariffs on China until the Ukraine war concludes.

title: Delhi's Bhai Dooj gift: Pink Card registration begins from Oct; free bus travel for women
content: The Delhi government is gearing up to launch its Pink Card initiative by mid-October, offering women lifetime free bus travel as a Bhai Dooj gift. Registration for the 'Saheli Smart Card' will be online, requiring KYC verification through selected banks.

title: 'Kohli isn't there': Ex-Pakistan captain warns India
content: Former Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq believes Pakistan has a golden opportunity in the upcoming Asia Cup clash against India. He suggests Virat Kohli's absence makes India's batting line-up vulnerable if Pakistan's bowlers strike early. India's recent Asia Cup opener saw a dominant win against UAE, fueled by Kuldeep Yadav's spell and quickfire batting.

title: ‚ÄòImage must change‚Äô: Tharoor says India seen unsafe for women; flags tourism inequality
content: Shashi Tharoor urges India to prioritize women's safety for tourism growth. He highlights tourism's potential to combat unemployment and generate revenue. Tharoor criticizes the lack of mid-range tourist facilities. He emphasizes the need for more hotels and improved infrastructure. He notes that India attracts fewer tourists than smaller destinations. Tharoor calls for giving tourism greater priority.

title: Asia Cup: Shoaib Akhtar's brutal India vs Pakistan prediction - 'Hammer you down'
content: India and Pakistan are set to clash in a highly anticipated Asia Cup match in Dubai, following dominant wins in their opening games. Shoaib Akhtar predicts India will aim to dominate Pakistan, emphasizing the need for Pakistan to perform at their peak. The match promises to be an exciting chapter in the storied rivalry.

title: Pune techie attacked with billhook outside Vimannagar; accused arrested
content: In Pune, a 33-year-old IT professional was brutally attacked with a billhook outside his fianc√©e's workplace in Vimannagar. Two men, later arrested, assaulted him due to mistaken identity, fueled by a cab driver's suspicion of a love affair. The victim sustained severe injuries, prompting calls for increased security and patrolling in the area, highlighting rising concerns about criminal activities.

title: ITR filing: Over 6 cr returns submitted so far; Sept 15 deadline looms for taxpayers
content: The Income Tax Department announced it has received over six crore income tax returns for the Assessment Year 2025-26. The deadline for filing without penalty is September 15th. The department's helpdesk is available 24/7 to assist taxpayers. An extension was granted due to revisions in ITR forms. ITR submissions have been steadily increasing, with a record 7.

title: IND vs PAK | 'Big match, but not for Pakistan': Saim Ayub makes massive claim
content: Saim Ayub downplays the hype surrounding the upcoming Asia Cup clash between Pakistan and India, emphasizing the team's focus on the present and their goal of winning the tournament. Despite recent struggles with his personal form, Ayub expresses confidence in the team's support and highlights the importance of adapting to the pitch conditions in Dubai.

title: 21-yr-old woman gang-raped in Pak Afghan refugee camp; five booked
content: In a shocking incident at Afghan Refugee Camp No. 16 in Haripur, a 21-year-old woman was brutally sexually assaulted by five men. The victim was allegedly dragged into nearby fields while en route to work, where she was raped for two hours, robbed of her valuables, and beaten when she resisted.

title: Hyderabad murder: Man who repeatedly struck Renuka with pressure cooker arrested
content: Hyderabad police have apprehended Harsh and Roushan in Ranchi for the brutal murder of 50-year-old Renuka Agarwal at her Kukatpally flat. The attackers, who repeatedly assaulted Agarwal with a pressure cooker and stabbed her, sought access to valuables. After the murder, they stole gold and cash, changed clothes, and fled, but were traced via CCTV footage and a manpower agent.

title: Luka Doncic meets Sharapova: $25M milestone; fans react to viral moment
content: Luka Doncic, the Los Angeles Lakers star, made headlines during the 2025 EuroBasket despite Slovenia's loss to Germany. Following his Lakers deal extension, Doncic purchased a $25 million ocean-facing house in Manhattan Beach, previously owned by Maria Sharapova. He also reflected on his initial nervousness playing against his teammate LeBron James, whom he idolizes.

title: 'Will watch in burqa‚Äô: Nitesh Rane mocks Aaditya over India‚ÄìPakistan match
content: Maharashtra Minister Nitesh Rane mocked Aaditya Thackeray, suggesting he'd secretly watch the India-Pakistan cricket match in disguise. This jab followed Thackeray's criticism of the BJP for allowing the match despite Pakistan's history of terrorism.

title: ‚ÄòRPM was high‚Äô: Woman describes moment Thar flew out of Delhi showroom
content: A woman testing a Mahindra Thar in a Delhi showroom accidentally accelerated, crashing through a glass wall and plunging 15 feet. Despite the dramatic accident, the woman, her husband, and a showroom employee escaped with only minor injuries. The woman has since refuted rumors of serious injury or death, attributing the incident to high RPM.

title: Asia Cup: Tit-for-tat! After IPL franchise, now PSL team boycotts IND vs PAK
content: Ahead of the highly anticipated India-Pakistan Asia Cup 2025 clash, off-field controversies have erupted. PSL franchise Karachi Kings mirrored IPL's Punjab Kings' veiled reference to Pakistan, sparking online backlash. An Indian Supreme Court plea sought to cancel the match, citing terrorism concerns and national security, but was denied an urgent hearing.

title: Charlie Kirk killing: Arjun Tendulkar pays tribute; posts Instagram story
content: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk was fatally shot during a campus tour stop at Utah Valley University, sparking widespread grief. The incident occurred shortly after a question about mass shootings by transgender individuals. Indian cricketer Arjun Tendulkar, among others, shared condolences, highlighting Kirk's global influence. Tendulkar's message reflects the shock following Kirk's murder.

title: ‚Äò8-10 rounds were fired‚Äô: Disha Patani‚Äôs father Jagdish Patani reacts to home attack
content: Gunshots were fired at actress Disha Patani's family home in Bareilly, with her father, Jagdish Patani, confirming the use of foreign-made weapons. The Goldy Brar group claimed responsibility, citing alleged disrespect towards religious figures. Police have launched an investigation, registered an FIR, and increased security for the Patani family, with multiple teams working to apprehend the assailants.

title: Delhi riots case: Amnesty, 6 other global rights' bodies seek Umar Khalid's release
content: Amnesty International and other human rights organizations are urging the Indian government to release Umar Khalid, a former JNU student, highlighting his prolonged detention as a symbol of repression against those exercising free expression. They criticize the selective prosecution of activists opposing the Citizenship (Amendment) Act while officials allegedly inciting communal tensions enjoy impunity.

title: Ranji Trophy: Big Blow for Kerala! Cricketer joins Maharashtra before new season
content: Jalaj Saxena, a seasoned all-rounder, has signed with Maharashtra for the Ranji Trophy 2025-26 season, leaving Kerala after nine years. The Maharashtra Cricket Association welcomes Saxena, highlighting his experience and mentoring abilities. Alongside Prithvi Shaw, Saxena aims to bolster the team's performance, bringing his impressive domestic record and IPL experience to Maharashtra.

title: Food Delivery Agent Crushed To Death By Speeding Truck In Gurugram
content: A 20-year-old food delivery agent was killed in a road accident after being crushed by a speeding truck near the Southern Peripheral Road (SPR), police said on Saturday.

title: Pakistan's Surveillance Of Its Citizens Not Security But Tyranny: Report
content: The track record of Pakistan's current civil-military regime paints a bleak picture of the country's future.

title: Nepal To Hold Parliamentary Elections March 5
content: Nepal President Ramchandra Paudel on Saturday called on all sides to cooperate in conducting fresh elections to the House of Representatives that are to be held on March 5

title: Amid Seat-Sharing Troubles In Bihar, Tejashwi Yadav's 'All-243' Appeal
content: Amid a push from Mahagathbandhan allies for a larger share of seats for the Bihar Assembly elections, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has made an appeal to the people of the state and said they should vote on all 243 seats in his name.

title: Leaning On His Casket, Charlie Kirk's Wife Weeps During Final Goodbye
content: A wife weeping with head bent over husband's open casket - the soul-wrenching picture was shared by Charlie Kirk's wife, Erika, on social media.

title: Bomb Threats At Taj Palace, Max Hospital Declared Hoax
content: Bomb threats received through e-mail on Saturday sent Taj Palace and Max Hospital staffers into tizzy which were later declared "hoax" following extensive searches by Delhi Police, an official said.

title: "India Struck 11 Pak Airbases With Precision": Army Chief On Operation Sindoor
content: Lt Gen KJS Dhillon (Retd) on Saturday shared his insights on India's Operation Sindoor, highlighting key aspects of the operation, emphasising India's strategic victory.

title: Top Court To Decide On Pleas Seeking Stay On Waqf Law On Monday
content: The Supreme Court is slated to pronounce on September 15 its interim orders on three key issues, including the power to denotify properties declared as "waqf by courts, which cropped up during the hearing of pleas challenging the validity of the Waqf

title: 'Bhupen Hazarika's Songs Unite India': PM In Guwahati
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday asserted that Bharat Ratna awardee Bhupen Hazarika's songs continue to unite India and give energy to its people.

title: Kash Patel To Face Congressional Hearing Over Missteps In Kirk Murder Probe
content: Hours after the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, FBI Director Kash Patel declared online that "the subject" in the killing was in custody. The shooter was not. The two men who had been detained were quickly released.

title: Nasa Expels Chinese Nationals Over Espionage Fears
content: NASA has announced new restrictions barring Chinese nationals holding US visas from accessing its facilities, research programs, and internal networks.

title: Romanian Phd Student At BHU Found Dead Under Suspicious Circumstances
content: A Romanian student pursuing a PhD in Indian Philosophy at Banaras Hindu University (BHU) was found dead under suspicious circumstances at her rented accommodation in Varanasi, police said on Saturday.

title: Kickstarting Statewide Tour from Trichy, Vijay Attacks DMK, Promises Change
content: Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) chief and actor Vijay launched his much-anticipated statewide political tour in Tiruchirappalli on Saturday, kickstarting what is being seen as his first major step toward the 2026 Assembly elections.

title: Ketamine, Chemicals Worth More Than Rs 5-Crore Seized In Madhya Pradesh
content: Two persons were arrested with ketamine and chemicals worth more than Rs 5 crore in Madhya Pradesh's Agar Malwa, the biggest seizure of drugs in the district, police said on Saturday.

title: Fire Breaks Out At Oil Refinery After "Terrorist" Attack By Drones: Russia
content: A fire broke out at the facilities of an oil company in Russia's Bashkortostan region following a drone attack on Saturday, the governor said.

title: Zohran Mamdani Repeats Threat To Arrest Netanyahu In New York If Elected
content: Democrat nominee for mayor of New York City, Zohran Mamdani has said that if he is elected he would order for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to be arrested by the New York Police Department if he enters the city.

title: Case Filed Over AI-Generated Video By Congress On PM Modi, His Mother
content: Delhi Police on Saturday registered an FIR on a BJP worker's complaint over an AI-generated "deepfake" video posted by the Bihar Congress unit on its X handle that allegedly tarnished the image of PM Narendra Modi and his late mother

title: 'Swimming, Survival, Seva': Tales Of Families Living In Delhi's Yamuna Bazaar
content: Along the Yamuna Bazaar area here, children are taught to swim almost as soon as they start walking. For families living on the riverbank, swimming is not a sport but a survival skill passed down generations for protection against the river's dangers

title: Watch: PM Modi's Adorable Moment With School Students In Manipur
content: In a video shared on the social media platform Instagram by PM Modi himself, four schoolgirls are seen singing 'Bharat Ki Beti', a song from the Bollywood movie 'Gunjan Saxena'.

title: High Political Pitch, Boycott Calls Ahead Of India-Pak Asia Cup Face-Off
content: The India vs Pakistan fixture in the Asia Cup tomorrow has yet again raised the political temperature in the country.

title: Vikings' classic uniforms, Bengals' orange tops NFL Week 1 threads
content: the Vikings will be the first team to rock throwback uniforms in week 2 of the new season . the look borrows design elements from some of the earliest uniforms with a deeper purple than the modern version . for the second straight season, the Cincinnati Bengals are rocking orange jerseys .

title: NFL Week 2 best bets: What will Josh Allen do for an Encore?
content: new bets will be tracked throughout the season, with flat one-unit wagers for each listed bet . the odds will be from ESPN BET as the odds be determined . this file will be updated through Saturday with new wagers, including defensive player props .

title: After season of adversity, can Liberty put together another title run?
content: the 19-point win made them the ninth team in WNBA history to start a season 9-0 . only the top four seeds get home-court advantage in the best-of-three opening series . the Liberty finished fifth in the 2025 championship .

title: Our guide to every Week 2 game: Matchup previews, predictions, picks and nuggets
content: the week 2 NFL schedule for the 2025 season brings some exciting matchups . the Lions will " welcome " former offensive coordinator turned NFC North foe Ben Johnson back to Ford Field . quarterback Joe Flacco will return to Baltimore to face the Ravens in a super bowl rematch .

title: Kings' Perry has knee surgery, out 6-8 weeks
content: Corey Perry was injured while skating at his new team's training complex . the 40-year-old has agreed to a one-year, $2 million contract laden with incentives . he has played in the Stanley Cup Final in five of the past six seasons .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Every game in the first round, starting Sunday
content: the 2025 WNBA playoffs open Sunday . all eight teams are in action, with the no. 1 seed Minnesota Lynx taking on the expansion franchise Golden State Valkyries . the red-hot Las Vegas Aces host the Seattle Storm .

title: 'He threw the freakin' shoe!': Revisiting Marco Wilson's infamous toss five years later
content: college football's Marco Wilson throws an LSU player's shoe in the fourth quarter of a rivalry game on Dec. 12, 2020 . the throw, which came in a tie game against a heavy underdog, certainly cost Florida a win . five years later, the play proved a turning point in the history of an once-proud Florida program .

title: Pitchers share what it's really like facing Aaron Judge
content: new york Yankees superstar Aaron Judge has hit more home runs since his debut . he is putting the finishing touches on his fourth season with at least 40 home runs and his fourth straight with an OPS over 1.000 while entering the final weeks with the American League MVP award within his reach . judge is ranked at 6-foot-7, 282 pounds .
